plants.name: Crocus vernus
plants.description: A bulbous perennial flowering plant that produces vibrant cup-shaped flowers signaling the start of spring in many temperate regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late winter to early spring (February to April)
plants.location: Europe and parts of North America
plants.funFact: Crocus flowers are among the first to emerge in late winter, often blooming through the snow, heralding the coming spring.

plants.name: Mahonia aquifolium
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its holly-like leaves and bright yellow flower clusters that bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting early pollinators.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Oregon grape is not a grape but produces blue-black berries that are edible and used to make jams.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant prized for its white flowers that bloom very early, often in winter, surviving cold conditions in woodland gardens.
plants.funFact: The Christmas rose was a popular plant in Victorian-era gardens and symbolizes hope during the darkest months of the year.

plants.name: Tillandsia ionantha
plants.description: A small epiphytic bromeliad that can bloom indoors or in warmer climates naturally in winter to early spring, with striking pink bracts and purple flowers.
plants.funFact: Air plants absorb moisture and nutrients through their leaves and don't require soil to grow, making them popular houseplants.
